list.question: Is Chosen different than Child Sponsorship?
answer: No, they are both monthly donations to either Mposa or Chamba. The only difference is that instead of the sponsor choosing the sponsor child, the sponsor child chooses their sponsor. The goal of this is to continue making steps to equalize power with our partner communities.

list.question: I signed up for Chosen. When will I see who chose me?
answer: You will receive an email on June 6 with the information of the child who chose you.

list.question: Why participate in sponsorship?
answer: The Chosen initiative and child sponsorship are fundraising initiatives that help build connections between donors and our partner communities. Funds donated are invested into the entire community and not specifically the child that is sponsored. This ensures that the entire community is moving out of poverty rather than just selected individuals and families. This leads to a more resilient and flourishing community.

list.question: When will we financially transition from supporting Mposa and Chamba?
answer: The dates are not certain, but we are planning to transition within the next five years. This is the last opportunity for our church to participate in sponsorship with Mposa and Chamba.

list.question: How are Kidmax and Youth participating?
answer: Kidmax and Youth are participating with adults by learning about the importance of investing into poverty alleviation globally and through participation in Chosen. For creative ways to engage children and youth, refer to the resource section.

list.question: Why partner with World Vision?
answer: We have a longstanding partnership with World Vision that dates back to the start of our relationship with Mposa and Chamba. We have been strong partners ever since because of our shared values of Jesus-centredness as well as their strong reputation in the field of international development. World Vision plays an international leadership role improving outcomes in the areas of education, health, and economic growth with a specific focus among vulnerable children. They are also a member of the Canadian Council of Christian Charities (CCCC) and the Better Business Bureau and were ranked as one of the top 100 charities in Canada in 2020 by Charity Intelligence Canada.

list.question: Do you live outside of Canada?
answer: If you live outside of Canada, but want would like to participate in the campaign and be chosen, you can email Matt at matt.thompson@themeetinghouse.com to sign up.
